review: I own both the fire stick and the fire TV. I love them both. After just setting it up and logging into Netflix to watch a movie, I can't tell the difference between the two devices. I'm not sure why anyone would by the $100 fire TV when this less expensive option does it all.The only thing I can tell for sure is loading time seems to be slightly longer. Is that my internet tonight? Is that Netflix's limited bandwidth on a high volume time? Or is it the device quality itself? I can't tell for sure today.

review: It was worth a try but I had the same experience as some others where the stick just wasn't powerful enough to connect with our wifi. We wanted to use it in our basement; the route is on the first floor. We have a Fire TV that can connect to our wifi from the basement but the stick could not. I also wasn't trilled about having to plug the stick into a power outlet. I had thought one advantage of the stick was the clean look unencumbered by cords. The cord provided seems rather short - I would have needed an extension for it.
author: J. Gallant "mozart32"
